p: The hydrocarbons represented the second major class of compounds in coastal and inland plant samples with concentrations of 10.78% and 10.97%, respectively. The majority of the hydrocarbons were documented in the EOs of several plants around the world and herein from some Heliotropium species such as H. indicum [ 32, 34], H. europaeum [ 35]. Non-oxygenated hydrocarbons were characterized as major compounds of overall hydrocarbons with concentrations of 9.71% and 8.35% in addition to minor oxygenated hydrocarbons with concentrations of 1.07% and 2.62%.
